commercialBlock.title: Commercial Graphics & Print
commercialBlock.description: A scrapbook of projects I've worked on over the years. A lot of my work has been white label with a very strict "if you leave the office with our files, we WILL find you" policy, so please excuse me if "the process" isn't as well documented as I'd like. Not to toot my own horn, but until 2020, work was pretty steady, and the idea that I would need to keep my work for a portfolio was a very naive non-consideration. Hindsight! Am I right?

personalBlock.title: Personal Graphics
personalBlock.description: Odds and ends I've put together in my spare time. An eclectic body of work that highlights my cursed habit of never settling on one style. I'm the guy who looks at something and thinks: "How did they do that? Let's find out!" Some might say I'm a jack of all trades and a master of none. I say I'm a jack of all trades who gets the job done.

motionBlock.title: Motion Graphics
motionBlock.description: More of a passionate pastime than a profession for me. Motion Graphics is something I've been slowly growing into over the years. I've always been fascinated by the ability of motion to elevate even the most mundane illustrations into something really wild. Show someone a picture of a pop tart? Cute. Make that pop tart dance? Go viral!

webBlock.title: Web Development
webBlock.description: This is the newest member of the family, but don't be fooled by the new baby smell. Software is my passion. The marriage of flat graphics, audio, and video is where I really get to push the "jack of all trades" thing to the limit, and it's the thing I'm most excited about showing off in the future. (My wife says it sounds like ChatGPT wrote this. I say ChatGPT writes like me, and that's its own problem.)

commercial.name: Talking Across The Political Divide Event Schedule
commercial.description: A small one-shot event poster for a local seminar with the goal of helping people learn to see past each other's political differences and come together as a community.
title: Bridging The {

commercial.name: Print Works Collateral
commercial.description: An update to PrintWorks branding. It was a three-prong request for a marketing deck layout, business card, and digital newsletter. Per client request, I kept their traditional logo and opted to build a CMYK theme around it that mixes color and image overlays to draw focus to PrintWorksâ€™ specialization in print graphics and vehicle wraps.
title: Building {+
} Brand

commercial.name: Walton Buttons & Fridge Magnets
commercial.description: A contract job through All Points Media and PrintWorks to create a series of pin-back buttons and fridge magnets for Walton Physical Therapy. Taking into consideration the client's budget restrictions and very quick turnaround, I repurposed the existing Walton visual tone and affixed it to a series of circular and square layouts.
title: } Down

commercial.name: Camp Discovery Lodge Interior Layouts
commercial.description: A team project from my time at Gillespie Graphics. The client was renovating a fleet of cruise ships and needed interior graphics and dimensional signs for their Discovery Channel-themed teen lodge. My contribution was to take existing graphic samples provided by the client and expand them into scalable vector art panels that could be produced in interlocking strips to fit a variety of internal layouts such as the one pictured.
title: A {
} Of Discovery

commercial.name: Clackamas County Police Bike Stripes
commercial.description: A simple repurposing of existing stripes for Clackamas County police cruisers to fit a fleet of bikes. Not much else to say about this one. It's pretty self-explanatory.
title: } Explanatory

commercial.name: Curious Comedy Event Poster
commercial.description: An event poster for Curious Comedy's improv night. One of my earliest commercial pieces. I was given 100% creative freedom and decided to go for a cut-and-paste look in the style of Monty Python-era Terry Gilliam.
title: Laughing My {
} Off

commercial.name: Kelly Quinn Pumpkin Brew
commercial.description: This one is just a mockup but one I was fond enough of to put in my portfolio. Another early work inspired by the collage styles of Terry Gilliam and David Plunkert, it's a bottle label design for Kelly Quinn's seasonal pumpkin brew. Unfortunately, a hard drive malfunction means the box art and the rest of the branding is lost to time. To make up for it, I've included unused t-shirt branding for the brew club Kelly Quinn associated with.
title: A Scared {
} Drink

commercial.name: Scary Stories Book Cover & Bookmark
commercial.description: This one is commercial on a technicality simply because books are typically commercial products and no one just makes a book cover for fun....right? When I was a kid, the "Scary Stories To Tell In The Dark" books utterly terrified me. The stories themselves were tame enough, but Stephen Gammell's inky artwork was a thing of nightmares. Sometimes literally. This project was my trauma therapy.
title: Conquering My {
-s}

commercial.name: City Of Seattle T-Shirt
commercial.description: A Seattle-themed T-shirt designed in the style of Aaron Draplin. No client. I've just had enough people ask if I can do T-shirts that I decided it belongs here on a technicality.
title: Stealing Like An {

commercial.name: Kupo Net T-Shirt Designs
commercial.description: A series of T-shirts for Kupo Net, a Final Fantasy 14 community group. The mascot is a moogle, a cute teddy bear creature from the Final Fantasy game series. Kupo is the noise a moogle makes. The designs incorporate moogle motifs with other cute creatures from the series to create a collection of distinct minimalistic designs. Yes, one shirt is a parody of the Punisher logo. I thought it would be fitting for the members who enjoy taking on the game's toughest challenges.
title: Helping {
-s} ,Kupo!

commercial.name: Maxline Box Truck Layout
commercial.description: A lot of my design experience has been in vehicle graphics. Yet, somehow, this is the work I have the least examples of. The reason for this is usually contractual. This is one of those elusive vehicles. These jobs usually involved taking existing branding, recreating them as scalable vector graphics, and using photographs and measurements to create a blueprint, mockups, and scale them for application.
title: Vehicle {
-ix}

commercial.name: Bumble Ad Van Layout
commercial.description: A very specific job for a very specific client. APM owns a fleet of Digital AdVans they license out to brands for events. My job was often to create a proof of concept they could show a potential client to get them to sign on. Though not always visually appealing due to a very short turnaround (sometimes only hours before meeting a client), I still think it's worth showing. All I'd have was the client's name. The rest was on me.
title: Making A {
-ery}

personal.name: We The Wild
personal.description: I used to work with the bassist of a band called We The Wild. Good band. Check them out. I got bored during my lunch break and drafted up a poster concept. I went with a look that pulled from minimalist woodblock prints. I might have also had the box art to the cult Japanese film House within arm's reach.
title: Rocking {

personal.name: In The Future There Will Be Love
personal.description: A piece originally created in collage when I first learned how to use the lasso tool in Photoshop. I updated it a couple of years later as a vector graphic for my wife to put on a shirt.
title: The Heart {
-s}

personal.name: Samurai-?
personal.description: A Ukiyo-e inspired illustration of the Samurai class from Final Fantasy 14. Drawn at the request of a friend who wanted a new profile image for Discord.
title: } To The Chase

personal.name: Ker-Plunke-rt
personal.description: A series of illustrations inspired by the works of David Plunkert and Terry Gilliam. I've always had a fascination with the tactile nature of collage work and it wasn't long before I gained a reputation in collage as being the guy you go to when you want something to look intentionally crappy.
title: Copy & {

personal.name: I Can Type When I Want To
personal.description: I don't do too much typography. Not because I can't. I'm just recovering from deep-seated trauma caused by a college professor with a cult-like obsession with Helvetica.
title: Typo {

personal.name: Here There Be Dragons
personal.description: A single page illustration depicting the anxiety of the dice rolls in tabletop gaming. I'm a minimalist at heart and if I could, I would probably compose everything in high contrast black and white with only geometrically balanced circles, squares, and triangles. Alas, this dark urge conflicts with my desire to also be employable.

personal.name: The One Time I Won An Award
personal.description: As the title suggests, this one won an award. So it gets to be here by default. I've improved a lot since this. It was a class project to create a minimalist illustration of a randomly selected children's story. I might revisit it one day and give the concept the polish it deserves.
title: Little Pigs {

personal.name: Retro Hardware
personal.description: I started a series of illustrations of retro hardware during my lunch break at Gillespie Graphics. I never got past the one image. What can I say. Business was good and lunch breaks were short.
title: A Quick {

personal.name: Legally Distinct Character
personal.description: Another lunch break project. My wife loves Kirby and I love my wife. So what makes this legally distinct? The keen-eyed will notice that my Kirby wears a very nice hat. This is an image of him running home to get it.
title: Puff {

personal.name: Terrarium
personal.description: This was one of those illustrations where I flew by the seat of my pants and just let the digital ink flow. Not sure what it is, but I'm fond of it.
title: I Really {
} Know

web.name: Savory Scenes
web.description: A responsive front end for Savory Scenes. A fictional restaurant that features an interactive UI, reservation form, contact form, and Google Map integration.
web.technology: React, Sass, Google Maps API, Javascript, HTML5, CSS
title: Helping {
-s}

web.name: Art Square Redux
web.description: A MERN stack social media app for artists. A place for artists to share their work, get feedback, and find inspiration. This project is a work in progress and will be updated as I continue to work on it.
web.technology: React, Sass, Express, Node, Javascript, HTML5, CSS, MongoDB, Apollo, GraphQL
title: Helping {
-s}

web.name: Marvel Longbox
web.description: A serverless API that pulls data from the Marvel API and displays it in a searchable format. This project was my first benchmark towards my web development certificate. Collaborators are listed in the readme.
web.technology: Javascript, Jquery, HTML5, CSS, Marvel API, MediaWiki API, JsDelivr
title: Helping {
-s}
